abstract:
**Abstract**  
• A novel Multi-modal Time Series Analysis Model Based on Spiking Neural Network (MTSA-SNN) is proposed  
• The model integrates Pulse Encoder and Joint Learning Module to unify multi-modal temporal data representation  
• Wavelet transform enhances non-stationary time series analysis capability  
• Experimental validation shows superior performance on three complex time-series tasks  

**Introduction**  
• Traditional Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) face challenges in processing non-stationary time series data  
• Spiking Neural Networks (SNNs) offer event-driven computation but struggle with multi-modal fusion  
• MTSA-SNN addresses cross-modal synchronization and temporal feature extraction limitations  
• Key innovations include pulse-based encoding and adaptive weight allocation mechanisms  

**Related Work**  
• Existing approaches include ARIMA models and Fourier analysis for stationary time series  
• Deep learning methods like Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks suffer from gradient vanishing issues  
• Multi-modal models combine Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Bidirectional LSTM (BiLSTM)  
• SNN variants show promise in financial time series prediction but lack effective multi-modal integration  

**Methodology**  
• Pulse Encoder converts multi-modal data ($S_{image}$, $S_{series}$) to spike signals ($\hat{S}_1$, $\hat{S}_2$) via Leaky Integrate-and-Fire (LIF) neurons  
• Joint Learning Module employs Fourier Transform ($FT(s)$) and weight allocation ($P_{mtsa}$) for cross-modal fusion  
• Wavelet transform decomposes signals into LL/LH/HL/HH subbands for multi-scale analysis  
• Output layer uses residual connections to generate predictions ($J_{MTSA}$)  

**Experiment**  
• Evaluated on MIT-BIH Arrhythmia (98.75% accuracy), ETT (MSE 0.235), and stock market datasets  
• Outperforms LSTM (MAE 2.465 vs 0.961) and XGBoost in financial forecasting  
• Ablation studies confirm 23% performance gain from wavelet transform integration  
• Neuron activation heatmaps demonstrate enhanced temporal feature representation  

**Conclusion**  
• MTSA-SNN establishes new state-of-the-art in multi-modal time series analysis  
• Spike-based joint learning effectively addresses cross-modal information fusion  
• Wavelet transform significantly improves non-stationary data processing  
• Open-source implementation available for community validation and extension
